body.p: The Board concluded that retrospective application of the revised impairment test for goodwill would be problematic for the following reasons:

li.p: it was likely to be impossible in many cases because the information needed may not exist or may no longer be obtainable.

it would require the determination of estimates that would have been made at a prior date, and therefore would raise the problem of how the effect of hindsight could be separated from the factors existing at the date of the impairment test.
